meta.description: Registry of missing Champagne components that require Manus v2 design briefs.

briefs.notes: Patient portal home with cards for treatment plans, documents, payments, messages. Use Champagne hero logic but lighter, app-feel glass.
constraints: No marketing offers; purely logged-in product UI.
Gradient law and layer stack must still apply.
Design separate mobile and desktop states.

briefs.notes: Visual section explaining 0% finance, Tabeo integration, high-value implant/ortho finance.
constraints: Include 3-column financing options grid.
Include subtle calculator graphic or input metaphor.
Tie visually to treatment CTAs that use applyFinance.

briefs.notes: Champagne-branded chatbot panel for future AI Concierge. Dockable in bottom-right; can expand to full-height panel on mobile.
constraints: Include avatar zone, message stream, input bar.
Allow for quick action chips (implants, veneers, anxiety).
Must work on top of existing gradient hero surfaces without clashing.

briefs.notes: Layout for AI Smile Quiz results: primary recommendation + 2–3 secondary options.
constraints: Card layout mapping to Treatment Registry slugs.
Space for before/after thumbnail or iconography.
Strong CTA linking back into booking / finance flows.

briefs.notes: Dedicated team hero that matches Champagne style but is clearly not the homepage hero.
constraints: No reuse of sacred home hero composition.
Include subtle portrait silhouettes / clinic motif.
Blend serif heading with short, calm subheading.

briefs.notes: Patient Stories hero introducing real transformations and filters.
constraints: Space for filter chips (veneers, implants, aligners, 3D dentistry).
Soft gradient, gentle motion.
Include pathway to AI Smile Quiz and key treatments.

briefs.notes: Full-width 3D viewer section for CBCT, 3D printing, and digital scans.
constraints: Left: large 3D viewer frame; Right: text copy + bullet list.
Must be compatible with actual 3D embedding later.
Re-use spacing from composite two-column body archetype.

briefs.notes: Calm, soft hero for nervous patients, cross-linking sedation and The Wand.
constraints: Use softer dusk tones; avoid aggressive contrast.
Must allow 2–3 reassurance bullet points.
Include trust markers (years of experience, gentle dentistry).

briefs.notes: Hero explicitly for 3D printed veneers; permanent but more affordable vs porcelain.
constraints: Re-use CB_HERO_FINAL spacing.
Include price-positioning copy zone (eg. ‘More accessible than porcelain veneers’).
Visually nod to 3D printing tech without overshadowing the smile.
